"Mechanical Engineering R\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9: Good Example  EDUCATION SECTION:  This section should typically go first  because it is a students (or fresh  graduates) best selling point.  GPA: Include it if your GPA is 3.5 or  higher. If it is between 3.0-3.5,  including it will depend on the  company requirements. Do not  include your GPA if it is lower than  3.0.  Dates: Write dates in terms of  anticipated graduation, rather than  your start and finish dates, especially  if you are applying for an internship.  Relevant Coursework: Instead of just  listing the classes you took, describe  the skills and experience you gained  from the class(es).    GENERAL NOTES:  Get involved NOW in career-relevant organizations, projects, and gain other  professional experience so that you have relevant experience to include on your  r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9.  FORMAT GUIDELINES:  Mechanical Engineering r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9s should not be over a page, even if the engineer has  been in the industry for 10-15 years.  R\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9s are typically read by Human Resources and by department managers. Human  resources will typically take 30 seconds to make their \xe2\x80\x9cgo\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cno-go\xe2\x80\x9d decision.  Department managers will typically take 5 minutes to compare your r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9 with other  top candidates. Make sure that your r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9 accommodates both levels.  NOTE: Although references are important, they should be included on a separate page  with professional references listed first.    Extra-curricular involvement:  You can also include awards, honors,  and other extra-curricular  involvement in this section and/or in  a section of its own, depending on  what would be most appealing and  relevant to your audience. If you put  projects or classes in this section or  the professional experience section,  make it clear that it was unpaid work  and/or part of a class.  QUALIFCATIONS SECTIONS:  Professional Experience:  When describing your job duties,  skills, and accomplishments, dont  forget the \xe2\x80\x9cmeat & potatoes\xe2\x80\x9d (i.e.,  industry-relevant experience, specific  examples, etc.). Avoid using \xe2\x80\x98twinkies  (i.e., flowery language or irrelevant  experience). Provide concise,  powerful examples in each of your  bullet points. If you are short on  relevant experience, do your best to  make it relevant.  Missionary Experience:  Describe your mission in terms of  transferrable skills and experiences  that will benefit the potential  employer (i.e., problem-solving,  leadership, foreign language,  teaching, public speaking, etc.). Avoid  using church lingo like \xe2\x80\x98taught gospel  or \xe2\x80\x98zone leader.    R\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9 guidelines come from Aaron Schellenberg, BYU-Idaho Mechanical Engineering Department"
